private_information: I am agent robot1 responsible for executing a subset of the block manipulations.
I can hold at most one block at a time and can move only the top block of a stack.
robot1.goal: Execute and report the sequence of block actions assigned to me and observe the resulting local state.

private_information: I am agent robot2 responsible for executing the remaining subset of the block manipulations.
I can hold at most one block at a time and can move only the top block of a stack.
robot2.goal: Execute and report the sequence of block actions assigned to me and observe the resulting local state.

private_information: I coordinate robot1 and robot2 and must integrate their action logs and the initial state to produce a final planning instance.
My output must be a PDDL domain and problem targeted for the FastDownwards planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents reports into a single consistent PDDL domain and problem that captures the final arrangement of blocks for FastDownwards.

public_information: This is a standard Blocks World with single-table support and stacks of blocks.
Blocks present: A B C D E F G H I J.
Rules: only the top block of a stack can be moved, only one block can be held at a time, legal moves are unstack(x,y) pickup(x) putdown(x) and stack(x,y).
Initial arrangement: B is on the table and A is on B and G is on A and C is on G; I is on the table and D is on I and H is on D; E is on the table and J is on E; F is on the table.
Thus initial stacks bottom to top are: [B,A,G,C], [I,D,H], [E,J], [F].
A complete chronological action sequence was executed and must be integrated to compute the final arrangement.

report.system_prompt: You are robot1 in a two-agent Blocks World scenario. Provide a concise chronological report of the actions you executed and any local observations about the stacks after your actions. Do not emit PDDL. Report only facts you observed or actions you performed.
report.prompt: Your name is robot1. You are given the public environment description including the initial stacks and the general Blocks World rules. You were assigned the first part of the action sequence. Provide a single-line JSON-friendly string listing your executed actions in order and any observed changes to the stacks after each action. If you lack information about other agents moves, report only what you executed and observed locally.

report.system_prompt: You are robot2 in a two-agent Blocks World scenario. Provide a concise chronological report of the actions you executed and any local observations about the stacks after your actions. Do not emit PDDL. Report only facts you observed or actions you performed.
report.prompt: Your name is robot2. You are given the public environment description including the initial stacks and the general Blocks World rules. You were assigned the latter part of the action sequence. Provide a single-line JSON-friendly string listing your executed actions in order and any observed changes to the stacks after each action. If you lack information about other agents moves, report only what you executed and observed locally.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator producing a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate agents action logs and the initial state to build a single consistent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that captures the final arrangement after the given action sequence. Keep the actions of each agent distinct by prefixing or annotating actions with the agent name where appropriate. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive the two agents action reports and the public initial state. Your task is to integrate their reports, verify consistency, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file formatted for FastDownwards that represents the final world state after the entire action sequence. Keep agent actions distinct if needed to avoid name collisions. If inconsistencies arise, resolve them by preferring the chronological action sequence as provided. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Also include a short note in the problem description indicating that the target solver is FastDownwards.
